statements: UPDATE course_materials SET material_name='Lecture Slides', material_type='Presentation' WHERE id=1;
UPDATE course_materials SET material_type='Practice Questions', access_type='online' WHERE course_id=101;
UPDATE course_materials SET material_name = 'Lecture slides', material_type = 'Presentation' WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE course_materials SET access_type = 'offline', material_link = 'http://example.com/lecture1' WHERE course_id = 101;
UPDATE lecture_slides SET title='Introduction to Databases' WHERE id=1;
UPDATE readings SET reading_content='Chapter 2: Database Design' WHERE course_id=101;
UPDATE lecture_slides SET title = 'Introduction to SQL', created_at = '2022-09-01 10:00:00' WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE readings SET course_id = 101, reading_content = 'Advanced SQL Concepts', title = 'SQL Masterclass' WHERE id = 2;
UPDATE course_materials SET lecture_slides='Updated slides for Week 3' WHERE course_id=101;
UPDATE online_learners SET email='newemail@example.com' WHERE learner_id=201;
UPDATE course_materials SET lecture_slides = 'Updated Lecture Slides for Course A', readings = 'New Readings for Course A' WHERE course_id = 1
UPDATE online_learners SET email = 'learneremail@example.com' WHERE learner_id = 1
UPDATE lectures SET lecture_name = 'Introduction to SQL' WHERE lecture_id = 1;
UPDATE readings SET reading_content = 'Chapter 3 revised edition of the textbook' WHERE reading_id = 2;
UPDATE lectures SET lecture_duration = 90 WHERE lecture_id = 101;
UPDATE users SET user_email = 'john.doe@example.com', user_phone = '+1234567890' WHERE user_id = 201;
UPDATE course_materials SET lecture_slides = 'Updated slides for Lecture 1' WHERE course_id = 101;
UPDATE students SET email_id = 'newemail@example.com' WHERE student_id = 201;
UPDATE course_materials SET lecture_slides = 'Updated slides content' WHERE course_id = 101;
UPDATE enrollments SET enrollment_date = '2022-10-15' WHERE student_id = 201 AND course_id = 101;
